2025.title: PostgreSQL 16+ ecosystem growth
2025.description: PostgreSQL continues to lead in extensibility and advanced features in 2025, with wider adoption of PostGIS, Timescale, and built-in columnar storage optimizations for analytical workloads.

2025.title: Cloud-native managed databases (Aurora, Cloud Spanner, Cosmos DB)
2025.description: Managed cloud databases keep expanding features: serverless scaling, cross-region replication, and built-in analytics. Teams increasingly choose managed offerings to offload ops and gain global low-latency replicas.

2025.title: Vector databases for embeddings (Qdrant, Milvus, Weaviate)
2025.description: Vector-first databases are mainstream in 2025 for semantic search and retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) pipelines, with improved hybrid indexes and filtering for production ML systems.

2025.title: Redis as a multi-model platform
2025.description: Redis evolves beyond caching into a multi-model platform (RedisJSON, RediSearch, RedisAI) used for real-time features, leaderboards, and lightweight vector search at the edge.

2025.title: Time-series databases (TimescaleDB, InfluxDB)
2025.description: Time-series DBs gain traction for IoT, observability, and financial feeds; integration with stream processors and continuous aggregates becomes standard practice.

2025.title: Serverless and edge databases
2025.description: Serverless databases and edge-first sync solutions make offline-first and global-low-latency apps easier to build, with improved local-first conflict resolution and change streams.

2025.title: Graph databases and knowledge graphs
2025.description: Graph DBs like Neo4j and open-source alternatives are used to connect knowledge, power recommendations, and support entity-centric RAG systems combining vectors + graphs.

2025.title: Privacy-preserving storage patterns
2025.description: Encrypted fields, client-side encryption, and selective disclosure patterns become common for storing sensitive records, driven by regulations and zero-trust architectures.

2025.title: Multimodel databases and converged storage
2025.description: Databases increasingly support multiple models (document, graph, vector, relational) in a single engine to reduce data movement and simplify architectures.
